text: What’s the state of the <https://github.com/HubSpot/prettier-plugin-hubl|hubl prettier> plugin?

with `"prettier": "^3.2.5"` i am getting an error installing :cry:
```npm ERR! Could not resolve dependency:
npm ERR! peer prettier@"2.x" from @HubSpot/prettier-plugin-hubl@0.2.5
npm ERR! node_modules/@HubSpot/prettier-plugin-hubl
npm ERR!   @HubSpot/prettier-plugin-hubl@"*" from the root project```

hi guys, I'm starting to create content in HubSpot locally and I'm pretty new, I have a question that maybe one of you can help me: I want to create fields from the terminal (text type fields, image etc.)
but I do not know with what command I can create, because in the documentation there is
```hs create <type> <name> [dest]```
 to create a module for example but I can not find how to create html or css variables, if anyone has the answer I would be very helpful
you can’t write custom code with the cli. But the create commands to create projects from boilerplates
Use the vs code HubSpot extension for creating module fields and hubl snippets

thanks for replying <@U3T21PDBK>, I see that these fields I am trying to create are in a json file but an id is created automatically if you do it from the portal, let's say I want to add a text type field. is what I can not do.
Honestly I don’t use it so haven’t gone through the install process

yeah i’ll have to roll back with 2.x

I installed with `--force` but things break when mixing with 3.x
we just opened up an issue to resolve this.  thanks for breaking it for us, john :wink:
I'm getting issues when running `hs fetch --overwrite` lately. I can't get it to fetch all files, I get these errors every time.
